intro: Discocalyx suluensis, commonly known as the Sulu discocarp, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive disc-shaped calyx. The plant typically grows in forested areas and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with a yellowish or greenish hue. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
